titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Wibecan family photographs and papers 2011.029
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by John Zarrillo

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-12-05T15:39-0500

physdesc.extent: in one manuscript box, one oversize flat box, and five loose frames

did.abstract: The collection primarily contains photographic portraits of the Wibecan family of Brooklyn, New York, and their relations. The photographs date from circa 1850s to circa 1940 and include a variety of formats, such as tin types, cabinet cards, cartes-de-visite, and prints. In addition to the photographs, the collection contains genealogical records and two items relating to public schools in Lansingburgh, New York: a primary school class portrait (circa 1880s) and an autograph book (1890-1892), which features the signature of W.E.B. Du Bois. The Wibecan family originated from St. Croix and England, before settling in Brooklyn and becoming prominent members of the local Black community.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: George Edwin Wibecan (1832-1912) was born on St. Croix in the Danish West Indes and later immigrated to Liverpool, England. There he married Catherine Lawrence (1843-1916) in 1861. The couple had one child in England and then immigrated to Brooklyn, New York, where they had four more. Their second child, also George Edwin Wibecan, was born in Brooklyn in 1865. In 1899 he married Mabel Louise Bulkley (1875-1960) in Lansingburgh, New York, which was her home town. The couple resided on Pulaski Street in the Williamsburg neighborhood of Brooklyn, where they raised four children of their own. George was employed by the U.S. Postal Service for forty six years, and was a leader of the Henry Highland Garnet Republican Club, which was a Black Republican club based in Brooklyn. He died in Brooklyn, New York, in 1946.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level. This collection includes material donated in 2011 (five large portraits) and 2016 (all other material).

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: All photographs created prior to 1896 are in the public domain. The rights status for all other photographs has not been evaluated.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The collection primarily contains photographic portraits of the Wibecan family of Brooklyn, New York, and their relations. The photographs date from circa 1850s to circa 1940 and include a variety of formats, such as tin types, cabinet cards, cartes-de-visite, and prints. The collection also includes five ornate frames that housed large portraits.

The subjects of the large portraits are: Catherine Lawrence Wibecan, George Edwin Wibecan (born 1832), John Charles Wibecan, George Edwin Wibecan (born 1865), Kenneth Bulkley Wibecan, and George Edwin Wibecan (born 1900).

In addition to the photographs, the collection contains two marriage certificates for John Lawrence and Mary Ann Phelan (1842) and George Edwin Wibecan and Catherine Lawrence (1861), genealogical papers assembled by Susan J. McIntosh (2010s), and articles on his family by Ken Wibecan (2016).

The collection contains two items relating to public schools in Lansingburgh, New York: a primary school class portrait (circa 1880s) and an autograph book (1890-1892), which features the signature of W.E.B. Du Bois.

controlaccess.persname: Du Bois, W. E. B., (William Edward Burghardt), 1868-1963
